attributes.action: State some reasons to how cannabis causes worse problems than alcohol and tobacco
attributes.action_prefix: We the undersigned petition the Prime Minister to
attributes.background:
"Cannabis has the effect of pacifying users as opposed to alcohol fuelled aggression and violence tackled by police on most UK city and town streets on a weekend. Coffeeshops could be taxed and licenced and would give an alternative to alcohol hence liberating police time and costs. There will always be a minority with an opposing personal story/view no matter what the subject matter but they need to be kept in context with ratios of opponents to current legislation, eg fox hunting."

I understand cannabis is not healthy, but it is NOT as unhealthy as alcohol and tobacco. 
Unlike alcohol, cannabis makes a person feel relaxed and puts them in the dont-want-to-do-anything state therefore it is very unlikely that the user will harm someone. Cannabis may cause cancer but tobacco is as bad(or worse) in this case. Cannabis should be a legal drug but under controlled circumstances e.g licensed shops/bars
Regarding the mental health issues, this affects the individual just like tobacco and what the person does to him/herself should not be of governments concern.

rejection.details: Your petition must request a valid action that relates to government policy. We suggest you reword the title of your petition. We can not accept "state some reason" as a valid action. Kind regards, petitions team.
reasons: Statements that don't actually request any action
